description:
From Debian build system: http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=634406 > ====================================================================== > ERROR: test_invalid_methods (nova.tests.api.openstack.test_limits.WsgiLimiterTest) > ---------------------------------------------------------------------- > Traceback (most recent call last): > File "/build/nova-f1DdHP/nova-2011.2/nova/tests/api/openstack/test_limits.py", line 447, in test_invalid_methods > request.body = self._request_data("GET", "/something") > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 1173, in __setattr__ > object.__setattr__(self, attr, value) > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 498, in _body__set > raise ValueError("%s requests cannot have body" % self.method) > ValueError: GET requests cannot have body > > ====================================================================== > ERROR: test_resized_server_has_correct_status (nova.tests.api.openstack.test_servers.ServersTest) > ---------------------------------------------------------------------- > Traceback (most recent call last): > File "/build/nova-f1DdHP/nova-2011.2/nova/tests/api/openstack/test_servers.py", line 1029, in test_resized_server_has_correct_status > req = self.webreq('/1', 'GET', dict(resize=dict(flavorId=3))) > File "/build/nova-f1DdHP/nova-2011.2/nova/tests/api/openstack/common.py", line 34, in web_request > req.body = json.dumps(body) > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 1173, in __setattr__ > object.__setattr__(self, attr, value) > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 498, in _body__set > raise ValueError("%s requests cannot have body" % self.method) > ValueError: GET requests cannot have body > > ====================================================================== > ERROR: test_request_content_type_missing (nova.tests.api.test_wsgi.RequestTest) > ---------------------------------------------------------------------- > Traceback (most recent call last): > File "/build/nova-f1DdHP/nova-2011.2/nova/tests/api/test_wsgi.py", line 130, in test_request_content_type_missing > request.body = "" > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 1173, in __setattr__ > object.__setattr__(self, attr, value) > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 498, in _body__set > raise ValueError("%s requests cannot have body" % self.method) > ValueError: GET requests cannot have body > > ====================================================================== > ERROR: test_request_content_type_unsupported (nova.tests.api.test_wsgi.RequestTest) > ---------------------------------------------------------------------- > Traceback (most recent call last): > File "/build/nova-f1DdHP/nova-2011.2/nova/tests/api/test_wsgi.py", line 136, in test_request_content_type_unsupported > request.body = "asdf
" > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 1173, in __setattr__ > object.__setattr__(self, attr, value) > File "/usr/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/webob/request.py", line 498, in _body__set > raise ValueError("%s requests cannot have body" % self.method) > ValueError: GET requests cannot have body
title: GET requests cannot have body

comments.content:
This is only a problem in Cactus. However, the pip-requires file has webob pegged at v0.9.8, so maybe the debian package needs to be updated for that. How should we proceed?

Diablo w/ webob 1.0.8:

[brian.waldon@MX1YATM trunk]$ ./run_tests.sh api.openstack.test_limits:WsgiLimiterTest.test_invalid_methods
WsgiLimiterTest
    test_invalid_methods                                        OK  0.00

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 2.439s


Cactus w/ webob 1.0.8:

[brian.waldon@MX1YATM cactus]$ ./run_tests.sh api.openstack.test_limits:WsgiLimiterTest.test_invalid_methods
WsgiLimiterTest
    test_invalid_methods                                        ERROR

======================================================================
ERROR: test_invalid_methods (api.openstack.test_limits.WsgiLimiterTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/brian.waldon/valhalla/nova/cactus/nova/tests/api/openstack/test_limits.py", line 447, in test_invalid_methods
    request.body = self._request_data("GET", "/something")
  File "/Users/brian.waldon/valhalla/nova/cactus/.nova-venv/lib/python2.6/site-packages/webob/request.py", line 1173, in __setattr__
    object.__setattr__(self, attr, value)
  File "/Users/brian.waldon/valhalla/nova/cactus/.nova-venv/lib/python2.6/site-packages/webob/request.py", line 498, in _body__set
    raise ValueError("%s requests cannot have body" % self.method)
ValueError: GET requests cannot have body

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 0.003s


Cactus w/ webob 0.9.8:

[brian.waldon@MX1YATM cactus]$ ./run_tests.sh api.openstack.test_limits:WsgiLimiterTest.test_invalid_methods
WsgiLimiterTest
    test_invalid_methods                                        OK

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 0.004s
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: Make the Debian packaging use webob 0.9.8. is my vote.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content: Same here. So Thierry, looks like this is Invalid for nova.
